_88EquipmentBase.description: The descriptive base type for brew day equipment. Provides unique properties to fully describe the recipe.

_88EquipmentType.description: Provides necessary information for brewing equipment set.

___weight.description: The weight of the piece of equipment, especially important for when the mashtun is not preheated.

___grain_absorption_rate.description: The apparent volume absorbed by grain, typical values are 0.125 qt/lb (1.04 L/kg) for a mashtun, 0.08 gal/lb (0.66 L/kg) for BIAB.

___boil_rate_per_hour.description: The volume boiled off during 1 hour, measured before and after at room temperature.

___drain_rate_per_minute.description: The volume that leaves the kettle, especially important for non-immersion chillers that cool the wort as it leaves the kettle.

___specific_heat.description: The specific heat of the piece of equipment, expressed in Cal/(g*C), especially important for when the mashtun is not preheated.
